core libraries and there's lots of game libraries out there there's lots of different animation libraries and things like that you can use and i

middle of that screen i had this four colored circle right so the way i did that was i
went from the circle of the radius out to the to the out to the end of the radius and then didn't drew an arc over came back
to the middle filled that with a color then went over to the next color and then drew the next
wedge and then the next wedge in the next wedge and then as if i wanted to rotate and i had to change my starting point and then do all
those draws again now that's not super complicated actually it's pretty quick on these devices but it's complicated enough that you don't
want to have to do it every single time and sometimes maybe you'll have mario and you'll have a big sprite
that'll be very complex and have lots of different moving parts well you want to pre-render those into out to
a a different sub-element and then you can pull those into your main canvas page
whenever you need them okay this makes it a little simpler and you can also use things like rotate which is a function on canvas and

performance on the page itself there are things that redraw the page there's a huge list of them here's a
good example anytime you change any of these things on any element in your page your whole page has to be
recalculated now that means it doesn't mean things are changed very much but it means that
you're causing the browser to rethink which is causing processing cycles
anytime you do a query to even ask what something is in terms of its size or position on a
page you cause a recalculation of the page so this is a big deal because sometimes in
um your uh in in your uh scrolling for example or other events
you might call and say where is this thing where is this thing where is this thing i'm moving it across the page every time you do that the the browser
has to recalculate so what you want to do is de-bounce those things you want to basically buffer them and you know that way you
can throttle down how many times you're calling how many times you're querying the page which will make the page more performant okay
